text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Nick a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Cape Town
today I'm going to show you how to check
the current status of your VPN tunnel
using the AWS Management console let's
get started
after logging into the Amazon virtual
private Cloud console
navigate to site-to-site VPN connections
select your VPN connection
select tunnel details
review the status of your VPN tunnel
here you can see the current status of
your tunnel
as you can see the tunnel is up
and because this is a static VPN we can
also confirm the correct static routes
to the on-premise network is configured
now that we have confirmed the static
VPN is up let's look at the routing
table of your VPC to make sure that we
are routing traffic by using the VPN
let's go to the Amazon VPC console and
select route tables
select the route table
here we can add the routes manually
under routes edit routes or we can
activate route propagation which is the
preferred method
choose edit route propagation
and then select enable
choose save
now under routes you can see the routes
are propagated in the route table and
the column propagated is marked with yes
after logging in to the Amazon VPC
console navigate to cytosite VPN
connections
select your VPN connection
select tunnel details
review the status of the VPN tunnel
here you can see the current status of
your tunnel
as you can see the tunnel is up which
means ipsec and bgp are up
let's look at a case where ipsec is up
but bgp is down
here we can see the status is down and
the details column show that ipsec is up
this means that there are some bgp
configuration issues that must be
corrected
in this case after an investigation I
found a bgp configuration issue where my
customer Gateway has an incorrect PR IP
now that I've corrected the issue we can
see that PHP is up
now that we have confirmed the dynamic
VPN is up let's look at the routing
table of your VPC to make sure that we
are routing traffic by using the VPN
let's go to Amazon VPC console and
select route tables
select the route table
here we can add routes manually under
routes
edit routes
or we can activate route propagation
which is the preferred method
choose edit route propagation and then
select enable
choose save
now under routes you can see the routes
are propagated to the route table and
the column propagated is marked with yes
and now you know how to check the
current status of your VPN tunnel using
the console
thank you for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
